About Projects Skills CS 61B

Hi, I'm Austin.

I'm a student, teacher, software engineer, and gamer.

A little about me

My name is Austin Le, and I am a 3rd year undergraduate student at UC Berkeley pursuing a B.S. in Electrical Engineering & Computer Science (EECS).

I love learning, teaching, experimenting with technology, contemplating our complicated world, and playing video games.

On campus, I am the corresponding secretary of Eta Kappa Nu, Mu chapter (the EECS Honor Society), an undergraduate student instructor for CS 61B (Data Structures), and a facilitator & instructor of the Analytical Thinking in League of Legends DeCal.

In an academic setting, I enjoy studying both the theoretical and practical sides of computer science. However, my main interests lie in the applications of artificial intelligence, machine learning, computer graphics, and human-computer interaction that help create interesting and powerful technology that augments everyday life for people. Particular applications I am fascinated by are augmented reality, virtual reality, context-aware computing, smart devices, and novel ways of human-computer interaction.

Outside of school, I've recently gotten into developing my personal website and side projects, having been inspired by my work and co-workers this summer. I am also very passionate about online multiplayer video games and greatly enjoy what they have to offer: immersive worlds, challenging experiences, and team-oriented, strategic gameplay. I play a large variety of games, but currently mostly play League of Legends and Guild Wars 2. I have a particularly weak spot for the MMORPG and RPG genres.

In Summer 2014, I interned at Google's Mountain View office on the Feedback team, and in Summer 2015, I returned to work at Google's Seattle office on the App Engine Admin API team (part of Google Cloud Platform). Next summer, I will be a Software Engineering Intern at Riot Games in Los Angeles, working within their Service Availability Initiative.

Projects

League of Legends Ban Helper

This Google App Engine web application uses the Riot Games API for League of Legends and is written mainly in Golang. Users can look up a group of players to see statistics and get suggestions for bans when playing against those specific players. The application is intended for use in competitive playing environments.
Try it yourself!
